Author's Area Instructions & Templates

Submit your review ready papers

Deadline for submissions is 26 January 2020

Mange your submission in the Author's Area Dashboard

Instructions & Templates

Submit your Abstract

Whether you intend to submit a full written technical paper for peer review and inclusion in the Conference Proceedings or participate by offering an oral presentation only you must submit your abstract online by Sunday 27 October 2019.

This abstract will be available in the EuroBrake 2020 App which is used by delegates to select which presentations they would like to attend.

Abstracts should be 350-500 words and are entered as text into the online form.

When submitting your abstract, please ensure you specify who will be the presenting author and make sure you enter ALL the contributing author’s names and Companies.

Submit your Abstract

If your abstract has been accepted for presentation or as a poster at EuroBrake and you intend to submit a full written technical paper for peer review you are agreeing to follow FISITA's paper peer review process.

Abstracts should be 350-500 words and are entered as text into the online form. You must submit your review-ready paper by Sunday 26 January 2020 using the templates provided below. You must address any comments and concerns raised by the review team to their satisfaction in order for your paper to be approved for publication and these modifications MUST be completed no later than Sunday 12 April 2020. Abstracts should be 350-500 words and are entered as text into the online form.

Before preparing your Technical Paper it is vital that you consult/download the Instructions (pdf) and Microsoft Word template so that your paper is formatted correctly.

Instructions for Writing your Technical Paper (PDF document)

Technical Paper Template (Microsoft Word document template)

Technical Paper Example (PDF document) - coming soon

Please ensure your Technical paper is converted to PDF (files in any other format - i.e. Word - cannot be uploaded).

Final Versions of all approved technical papers, must be ready for publication in the EuroBrake 2020 Conference Proceedings by Wednesday 29 April 2020, please ensure you submit your paper final version by then as it will be this version used in the EuroBrake 2020 Proceedings.

Please remember that your paper must be original material that has not been previously published and is not under review by another conference or journal. If your paper does not comply with this rule it will be rejected.

Please check your Final PDF document carefully: No proof-reading or corrections will be made by the conference organisers. The Technical Paper must be submitted in English.

Final Abstract

If you wish to update your abstract please do so in your Author's Area by Wednesday 29 April 2020

The Final Abstract for each paper will appear in the EuroBrake 2020 App which is used by delegates at EuroBrake to decide which Technical Sessions to attend. The Proceedings and Abstracts are distributed to full delegates free of charge.

PowerPoint Presentation

All presentation data should be saved as PowerPoint files. All authors (i.e. those who have submitted a full written Technical Paper and those who are making an oral presentation only) should follow the guidelines below:

Instructions for Writing your PowerPoint Presentation (PDF document)

EuroBrake PowerPoint Template - 16:9 (PPT document) - Coming Soon

Please restrict the use of company logos or trade names to the first and last slides only.

Draft PowerPoint Presentations (Oral only and Technical Paper Submissions)

ALL accepted submissions must upload their draft slides no later than Friday 1 May 2020. There will be NO extensions to this deadline.

Your draft slides will be checked and suggestions for modifications will be made by the Review Team within 2 weeks.

Final PowerPoint Presentations(Oral only and Technical Paper Submissions)

Please update your slides using the modification suggestions given by the Review Team, and upload your final version no later than Sunday 24 May 2020. This version will be used in the session room on site unless you upload a new version at the event itself.

Permissions

FISITA would like to help you promote your work by publishing a pdf version of your slides on the Conference Website after the event. The link to download material will be sent to delegates after the event. ALL authors must choose whether or not to give permission for us to publish their slides in the ways mentioned above.

Speaker Registration

One author per submission must register to attend EuroBrake no later than Monday 27 April 2020. The primary author will receive a unique code to allow one author per submission to register at the reduced speaker rate. The use of the code will be checked and submissions with no registered author will be removed from the programme.

Copyright Assignment

ALL authors submitting a full written paper must assign copyright of their materials to FISITA in order for it to be published in the Conference Proceedings. Click here for details.

Speaker's Biography

All authors who are taking part in one of the technical sessions must provide a short biography of the speaker who will deliver the presentation at the Conference. This biography will be used by the session chairman to introduce the speaker. Please refer to the following Guidelines document:

Guidelines for writing your biography (PDF document)

Audio Visual Facilities at the Conference

All presentation data should be saved as PowerPoint files.

You must use the conference laptops for PowerPoint presentations. Please bring your presentation on a USB stick as a backup. (Conference laptops are PC-based; Apple platforms will not be supported.)

If you have any special Audio Visual requirements (e.g. video etc.) you MUST check with the organisers in advance of the congress to see if these can be accommodated.

Poster Presentations

ALL accepted submissions must upload their draft poster as a pdf no later than Friday 1 May 2020. There will be NO extensions to this deadline.

Your draft poster will be checked and suggestions for modifications will be made by the Review Team within 2 weeks.

Instructions for Poster Presentations (PDF document)

Please use the comments made by the Review Team to modify your poster and print this out and bring it with you to display on site.

Posters should be A0 size and in portrait orientation.

CONFIRMED EUROBRAKE 2020 SPONSORS
